data.title: Find the exit
data.statement:
{{X}} wakes up in a small, room with stone walls on all sides. There's no memory of how they got hereâ€”only the urgency to escape. The room has a few openings, some of which may lead to freedom, but others are mere illusions of hope. {{X}} must carefully examine their surroundings to find a way out before the door seals shut forever.

The room is simple, but the challenge is real: {{X}} must choose wisely to find the true exit and escape, or risk being trapped inside. The {{#}} symbols represent the walls of the room, and X must navigate through the spaces to find an exit.

Your mission is to help X escape from the room. You will be provided with the [[width]] and [[height]] of the room in the form of an ASCII grid. Each scenario presents a different room layout, and your task is to determine if there's a way out. Analyze the grid to see if an exit exists. If you find one, specify its location (the coordinates 0-based on [[y]] and [[x]] of the exit). If no exit is available, declare that {{X}} is {{TRAPPED}}.
data.stubGenerator:
read height:int
read width:int
loop height read row:string(1024)
write the_location_of_exit or TRAPPED
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1 :>> integer [[height]] represent the height of the room.
<<Line 2 :>>  integer [[width]] represent the width of the room.

<<Next [[height]] lines :>> string [[row]] part of the room
data.outputDescription: [[location]] of the exit [[y]] and [[x]] separated by space or {{TRAPPED}} if it doesn't exist.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

X wakes up in a small, room with stone walls on all sides. There's no memory of how they got here—only the urgency to escape. The room has a few openings, some of which may lead to freedom, but others are mere illusions of hope. X must carefully examine their surroundings to find a way out before the door seals shut forever.

The room is simple, but the challenge is real: X must choose wisely to find the true exit and escape, or risk being trapped inside. The # symbols represent the walls of the room, and X must navigate through the spaces to find an exit.

Your mission is to help X escape from the room. You will be provided with the width and height of the room in the form of an ASCII grid. Each scenario presents a different room layout, and your task is to determine if there's a way out. Analyze the grid to see if an exit exists. If you find one, specify its location (the coordinates 0-based on y and x of the exit). If no exit is available, declare that X is TRAPPED.
Input
Line 1 : integer height represent the height of the room.
Line 2 : integer width represent the width of the room.

Next height lines : string row part of the room
Output
location of the exit y and x separated by space or TRAPPED if it doesn't exist.
Constraints
0 < width, height < 20
Example
Input
5
7
#######
#.....#
#..X.. 
#.....#
#######
Output
2 6
